title: A causal role for the prefrontal cortex in music-induced reward
synopsis: TMS + fMRI showed left dlPFC causally modulates music-induced pleasure and motivation; changes in nucleus accumbens activity and fronto-auditory connectivity explain differences in liking vs wanting.
appraisal: Strong causal evidence linking cortical control to subcortical reward circuitry; laboratory setting and short sessions limit direct clinical translation.

title: Pleasurable music modulates reinforcement learning
synopsis: Pleasurable music biased reinforcement learning in a probabilistic selection task; effects depended on musical experience and listening style.
appraisal: Clear behavioral evidence linking music reward to learning processes; no direct neurochemical measures and limited ecological validity.

title: Music interventions for preoperative anxiety (Cochrane Review)
synopsis: Meta-analysis of 26 randomized trials found music listening reduced preoperative anxiety with a moderate effect size.
appraisal: Rigorous review methods with clinically relevant findings; heterogeneity across trials and variable study quality temper conclusions.

title: A brief music intervention reduces preoperative anxiety

title: Sensorimotor synchronization to music reduces pain
synopsis: Active synchronization (moving with music) produced larger pain reductions than passive listening or silence.
appraisal: Good experimental control and clear effect; lab models limit direct clinical translation to chronic/palliative populations.
